binary_file_format.name: Floppy
binary_file_format.comment: Template for an MSDOS (FAT12) floppy. Allows viewing of root dir and sub-dirs (to any depth) and clusters of individual files.

define_struct.comment: One entry in a directory. Use for root directory. It also recursively uses itself for sub-directories.

jump.comment: Look ahead at first byte of file name so we can check if it is an empty (0) or deleted (-27) entry.

data.name: status
data.comment: Indicates the status of the directory entry. 00 = unassigned, E5 = empty, otherwsie it is the first character of the file name.

data.name: name
data.comment: Name of file padded with spaces (ASCII 20h)

data.name: ext
data.comment: File extension - 0 to 3 characters (space padded)

data.name: attributes
data.comment: Attribute of the file: bit 0 = READ_ONLY, bit 1 = HIDDEN, bit 2 = SYSTEM, bit 3 = VOLUME NAME, bit 4 = DIRECTORY, bit 5 = ARCHIVE, bit 6/7 = ??

data.name: reserved
data.comment: Not used in MSDOS

data.name: fileTime
data.comment: Date and time the file was last modified.

data.name: startCluster
data.comment: This is the first cluster in the chain used by the file. If the file has zero size then this will be FFFFFFh to indicate the end of the chain. Note that clusters 0 and 1 are used by the root directory.

data.name: fileSize
data.comment: Size of the file in bytes. If not a multiple of the cluster size then there are unused bytes at the end of the last cluster.

eval.comment: Initialise next_cluster which keeps track of the current cluster in the chain of clusters used by this file/directory.

if.comment: Unused directory entries do not have clusters.

for.name: cluster
for.comment: Display all clusters until we hit the end of chain or bad cluster (cluster numbers above 0xFF0).

jump.comment: Jump to the location of the cluster.

struct.name: cluster
struct.comment: Handle one cluster - display directory entries in the cluster if a directory, or just display cluster data. Then calculate next cluster number.

if.comment: Test if this entry is for a sub-directory.

for.name: Entry
for.comment: Directory entries in a single cluster

data.name: fileCluster
data.comment: One cluster from the file.

eval.comment: Work out address of next cluster number, rounded down to even value.
Get the 3 bytes (24 bits) from the FAT table for the 2 entries (even and odd).
Finally work out the next cluster number. Use the low 12 bits for even clusters and high 12 bits for odd clusters.

data.name: JumpInstruction
data.comment: Usually a JMP (2 bytes) followed by NOP (1 byte)

struct.name: BPB
struct.comment: BIOS Parameter block - standard info. on layout of disk

data.name: bytesPerSector
data.comment: 512 for 3.5 inch FAT12 floppy

data.name: sectorsPerCluster
data.comment: Should be always be 1 for FAT12 floppy

data.name: reservedSectors
data.comment: Must be at least one (for boot sector)

data.name: numFAT
data.comment: There are typically 2 FAT tables, for redundancy.

data.name: numRootDirEntries
data.comment: Number of entries in root directory - normally 224 (7 sectors) for floppy

data.name: numSectors
data.comment: Number of sctors in data area (ie not including boot, reserved and FAT sectors)

data.name: mediaType
data.comment: F0 for 1.44Mb 3.5inch floppy

data.name: numFATsectors
data.comment: Should always be 9 for FAT12

data.name: numHiddenSectors
data.comment: Should be 0 for a floppy

data.name: numSectorsHuge
data.comment: Not used on a floppy

data.name: bootCode
data.comment: x86 code that boots to the OS if this is a boot floppy

data.name: magic
data.comment: A boot sector always has the last 2 bytes of 55h and AAh

data.name: ReservedSectors
data.comment: Normally this is empty as the only reserved sector is the boot sector (above)

struct.name: FAT
struct.comment: Area of disk reserved for one or more FAT tables.

jump.comment: Look ahead at the first FAT table

data.name: byte
data.comment: First FAT table

data.name: allFatBytes
data.comment: Sectors reserved for FAT table(s)

for.name: RootDirEntry
for.comment: Entries in root directory of floppy

data.name: data
data.comment: Rest of floppy after root directory
